entry.title: In A Week... Or So
entry.summary:
Author: auoph

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,769Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 20

Summary: It's dumb. I mean, who would use Lex Luthor as a self-insert for a Superman fan fiction? That would be... ridiculous.That "who" in question just so happened to be Bruce Wayne.Or Bruce is so horrendously down bad for Clark, he decided to write fanfics about Superman and Lex Luthor.

entry.title: The Heroes I Raised
entry.summary:
Author: Sweet_Ru07

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,903Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 217

Summary: when a new magical threat arrives in Gotham, all it's heroes gather to confront it despite their strained relationship with one another. however, despite their best efforts, tragedy strikes. And Bruce Wayne, surrounded by the bodies of his children, is given a chance to try again. with his dying breath he vows, he will do better, no matter what it takes, he will save them this time.This fic is inspired by the webtoon "The S-Classes Raised" but does not require prior knowledge of it, this is my first time writing for these characters and I accept any constructive criticisms. will update the tags as I go

entry.title: All Robins Go To Therapy (Eventually)
entry.summary:
Author: v_Artemis_v

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 21,327Chapters: 21/21Kudos: 135

Summary: Bruce Wayne is cursed into a ten-year-old's body after trusting a suspiciously charming witch named Araya. The catch? The spell punishes him based on emotional repression, loneliness, and general Batman-ness. Cue bat ears, glittery hands, glowing skin, and the slow deterioration of Bruce’s ability to lie, isolate, or emotionally deflect.His family assumes he’s some new Robin that Batman picked up—until Barbara figures out the truth and Operation Siege Dad begins.What follows is emotional sabotage, forced sibling bonding, Mean Girls, glitter-based aggression, magical body horror, and the most unhinged Justice League debrief in Watchtower history. All in the name of saving Bruce Wayne from himself.And also turning him back into an adult. That’d be nice too.

entry.title: Knights' Song
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,964Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 184

Summary: Due to a magic-based mishap, Batman's internal dichotomy is upended into an external dynamic. The rest of the Batfam and Justice League can only watch on, both fascinated and disturbed.Or...Bruce Wayne has never had so much free time on his hands. He decides to spend it coaxing a grumpy Bat into letting himself be adopted sideways into brotherhood, meddling in his sons' lives, and messing with the Justice League. This works out better than anyone could have reasonably anticipated.

entry.title: The Hundred Day Curse
entry.summary:
Author: SolaceInSpace

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 122,010Chapters: 32/?Kudos: 3,286

Summary: Gotham was literally cursed but no one believed Bruce. He took it upon himself to fix it and after decades of searching, that solution came to him in the form of a little blue vial. Bruce was to take the curse within himself to temper it into something manageable.He thinks the others would call him stupid and stop him if they knew about this, but (un)fortunately for Bruce, his family hasn't spoken to him for forever. There was no one here to stop him.He downed the liquid and woke up as his nine-year-old self.Ch3 Excerpt:“Mother, do you remember those funny clouds above people’s heads I told you about? Well, I’m doing something about them but the process is very lonely. Or not. I think it’s just me. I’m the problem. I can’t seem to get people to like me enough to stay. I know–-… I’m aware that it’s due to my own shortcomings but sometimes, it feels like even the worst monsters have people that love them and yet I have no one.”Bruce let out a humourless chuckle and rested his forehead on his knees.“I just wish there was someone that cared about me.”

entry.title: Long Live the Grit King
entry.summary:
Author: Mia_Da_Cat

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,647Chapters: 1/6Kudos: 11

Summary: Sequel to "The Gritty Wisdom of Jason Todd".The Bat-family has sworn fealty to their new, gritty, no-belly-button Batman. The problem? Jason is still high, and now they have to get him home.Follow the newly-dubbed "Grit Knights Council" as they hold sacred trials in the alley where Jason once stubbed his toe, perform the legendary "Gotham Brood Strut," and establish a new Batcave (the 'Grotto of Grit') in the wine cellar. Meanwhile, Bruce has seen the footage and is coming to reclaim his title. He is about to learn a terrible truth: You can't ground Batman.(Features 24 unhinged voicemails and a tragic eulogy for a donut.)

entry.title: Batman: A Robins Rising
entry.summary:
Author: MiriamElena

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 482Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 4

Summary: He was always shroud in darkness and deathly quiet. If you caught a glimpse of him, it was the yellow on his chest and the sharp, reflective, white of his eye; and by then it was far too late. He operated off of his own principles.He had his own code.But it quickly became clear that the city was under his control, it didn’t matter who or what got in his way, he was going to keep Gotham city safe. Afterall, Gotham is Batman’s city. And Batman will do whatever it takes to protect his city.

entry.title: Maudlin
entry.summary:
Author: PutYourRecordsOn

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 53,482Chapters: 19/35Kudos: 85

Summary: (can be read without knowledge of Mission impossible or Batman only requires understanding of one)Before he was the IMF’s favorite tech guy, Benji Dunn was something else entirely—a medic for the League of Assassins, a reluctant part of their world, and somehow the only non-assassin adult Damian Wayne trusted. He never meant to care. He never meant to stay. And he definitely never meant to walk away from it all broken.Years later, the past doesn’t just catch up—it breaks the door down. With the Entity threatening the future, Damian and Jason back in his orbit, and Ethan Hunt watching him like he sees every secret Benji’s tried to bury, the life Benji built is starting to crack.A story of found family, sharp edges, and soft hearts. Of missions and mistakes, art and tea, and what it means to choose kindness in a world that asks you to kill.

entry.title: summer in Kansas
entry.summary:
Author: rednesslover

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,538Chapters: 15/18Kudos: 404

Summary: Something’s off in Gotham—Batman knows. But that’s routine. Until it threatens Damian’s safety.It’s the second time Bruce takes him away from the city. At least this time, he’s driving—not Dick. That meant something: he didn’t want to do this, but had no choice.Still, Damian is furious. Of course he is. He’s not even going to the Titans Tower—his second home, his second family. And it’s all Dick’s fault.He’s angry because he can’t joke with Beast Boy over veggie pizza, or mock BB with Jaime, or suffer through Superboy’s endless talk about fangirls, or meditate with Raven. And Kori… just thinking about her hurts. It’s not his fault, he knows, but it still feels like betrayal.Bruce wants to take him somewhere far—no crime, no pressure, no “Robin.” Just peace. At least until everything settles in Gotham. And this time, he trusts someone to help.What Damian doesn’t know is that Bruce’s mysterious “best friend”—who Damian didn’t even know existed—has a son, too.

entry.title: What Remains When the Monument Falls
entry.summary:
Author: Hasunohana

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,930Chapters: 4/4Kudos: 59

Summary: The Batcave had always held secrets, but none as raw as Jason Todd’s memorial—a shrine of glass and grief, a monument to the son Bruce Wayne had failed.Now, with the Batfamily closer than ever, Bruce decides it’s time to let go of the past. When Jason is summoned to the manor, he braces for the same old cycle of guilt and discord. Instead, he finds his father standing before the memorial, tools in hand, ready to shatter that symbol of pain once and for all.As the glass fractures, Jason is forced to confront the question that’s haunted him since he clawed his way out of the grave:Who is he now——when he’s no longer the dead Robin,—no longer the failed vigilante?
